overview: This subject introduces students to family-centered practice and engaging with families across the life course. Theories of family engagement are explored in the context of contemporary social work practice. The course will have a particular emphasis on the development of practice skill.
ilo: Articulate the theoretical foundations of social work practice with families;
Identify the key elements and logic of family systems. using a social work lens; and
Describe the development of social work practice with families over time.
generic_skills: Understand the development of family practice over time

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Hurdle - attendance at minimum 75% of tutorials
assessment.hurdle: Attendance at a minimum of 75% of tutorials throughout the teaching period is a hurdle requirement

date_times.contact_hours: 24 contact hours (8 x 1 hour lecture, 8 x 2 hour tutorial)
